thread.title: Wladimir Klitschko V Tyson Fury Back On
thread.title_full: Wladimir Klitschko V Tyson Fury Back On

title: Wladimir Klitschko V Tyson Fury Back On
text:
Wladimir Klitschko V Tyson Fury Back On 12:54,   Share by email Wladimir Klitschko has been given the all clear to fight Tyson Fury on 28 November after tests on his calf injury. 
The WBA Super, WBO and IBF world heavyweight champion (64-3-KO53) pulled out of their scheduled 24 October meeting last week just days after challenger Fury made press conference history by arriving dressed as Batman. 
But Klitschko, 39, has overcome the problem and will be able to defend his titles in Dusseldorf in eight weeks' time. 
Fury said via social media: "GREAT NEWS! Just heard from my team @HennessySports @peterfury that @Klitschko has had the all clear to box nov 28 DÃ¼sseldorf. #LETSGETITONNNN." 
Fury has suffered disappointment in the past with opponents pulling out. Former world champion David Haye twice called off bouts with the Mancunian. Promoted Stories
